result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger G Tallmadge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To pay $50 drug testing fee, joint & several with co-defendant

--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--Take all over-the-counter drugs as directed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug/alcohol screens
--To maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate, per Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency:  WSP

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:34 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Roger G Tallmadge in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #6

On Count #5, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions:
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--Take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--Take all over-the-counter drugs as directed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug/alcohol screens
--To maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate, per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $50 drug testing fee, joint & several with co-defendant

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 11:54 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 13, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial on December 15/16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on December 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 24, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 5, 2014 at 08:40 am.

Case called at 9:01 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Roger G Tallmadge appears via video, in-custody, from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight & sound sufficient

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Tallmadge waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Speedy trial waived
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
ADA Shock requests that given co-Defendant is already set for trial; set this matter for trial too
Recess: 9:07 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 11/5/14 at 8:40 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 11/24/14 at 9:30 am - Send notices (3) Schedule FSSC 12/9/14 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (4) Schedule JT 12/15-16/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 1:59 pm
Defendant Roger G Tallmadge in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; Count #5 charge and maximum penalties recited; reading of maximum penalties waived for Count #6.
Court finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count #5 & #6.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia  
-No contact with co-defendant

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit. 
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 2:09 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Preliminary Hearing: 10/17/14 at 8:30 am
